intro: Sertula officinalis, commonly known as the common sertula, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils. Sertula officinalis has been historically used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
